blocks.text: The ICOM IC-7300MK2 is the updated version of the IC-7300, an HF/50 MHz transceiver featuring RF direct sampling technology. New features include CW decode function, HDMI output for external display, IP remote control capability, and dual SMA RX-only antenna connectors.
To turn the transceiver ON, push [POWER]. To turn OFF, push and hold [POWER] for 1 second. The AF control adjusts audio output level. The RF/SQL control adjusts RF gain and squelch threshold.
To change the operating frequency, rotate MAIN DIAL. Touch the MHz digits on the display to access the band selection screen. The real-time spectrum scope shows signals across the band.
To change modes, touch the mode indicator on the display. Available modes are USB, LSB, CW, RTTY, AM, and FM. The IC-7300MK2 has a built-in CW decoder that displays decoded characters on screen.
The IP+ function improves 3rd order intercept point (IP3) performance when receiving weak signals adjacent to strong interference. The AD converter is optimized against signal distortion.
The IC-7300MK2 adds an HDMI port for connecting an external display, allowing you to view the spectrum scope and operating data on a larger screen.
Access the SET menu by pushing [MENU] and touching SET. Use the MULTI control or touch [+]/[-] to scroll and select items. Touch screen calibration and keyboard type settings are available.

blocks.name: IP Plus
blocks.description: Improves IP3 performance for weak signal reception near strong signals. Found in SET > Function.

blocks.name: Keyboard Type
blocks.description: Selects between Full Keyboard or Tenkey pad for text entry. Found in SET > Function > Keyboard Type.

blocks.name: Full Keyboard Layout
blocks.description: Selects keyboard layout when using Full Keyboard. Found in SET > Function > Full Keyboard Layout.

blocks.name: Network Name
blocks.description: Sets the network name for IP remote control (up to 15 characters: A-Z, 0-9, -, _). Found in SET > Network.

blocks.name: Network Radio Name
blocks.description: Sets the radio name for network identification (up to 16 characters). Found in SET > Network.

blocks.name: NTP Server Address
blocks.description: Sets the NTP server address for automatic time synchronization (up to 64 characters). Found in SET > Time Set.

blocks.text: Push QUICK to access the Quick Menu, which allows you to temporarily switch keyboard type and access other frequently used settings.
Connect a paddle or straight key to the [KEY] jack on the rear panel using the supplied 6.35mm (1/4") stereo plug. The internal electronic keyer supports both paddle and straight key operation.
The IC-7300MK2 features a built-in CW decode function. The DSP decodes received and transmitted CW characters and displays them on the decode screen in CW mode.

blocks.name: Key Type
blocks.description: Selects key input type: Paddle, Straight key, or Bug key mode. Found in KEYER > EDIT/SET > CW-KEY SET.

blocks.name: CW Key Speed
blocks.description: Sets internal keyer speed from 6 to 48 WPM. Access via Multi-function menu in CW mode.

blocks.name: CW Pitch
blocks.description: Sets CW sidetone and receive audio pitch from 300 to 900 Hz.

blocks.name: KEYER MEMORY
blocks.description: Stores up to 70 characters per memory. Characters available: A-Z, 0-9, / ? ^ . , @ and space. Asterisk (*) has special function.

blocks.text: The CW decode function works for both received signals and your transmitted CW, allowing you to verify your sending accuracy.

The IC-7300MK2 uses digital IF filtering processed in the FPGA with a 12 kHz IF frequency (updated from 36 kHz in the original IC-7300). Three filter widths are available per mode. Filter shape can be set to SHARP or SOFT.
Twin PBT (Passband Tuning) shifts the IF passband to reject interference. The spectrum scope shows the filter passband in real-time, helping visualize the effect of your adjustments.

blocks.name: Noise Blanker (NB)
blocks.description: Eliminates pulse-type noise from ignition systems. Touch NB on Multi-function menu to toggle. Adjust Level, Depth, and Width parameters.

blocks.name: Noise Reduction (NR)
blocks.description: DSP noise reduction for random noise. Touch NR on Multi-function menu to toggle and adjust level.

blocks.name: Auto Notch (AN)
blocks.description: Automatically attenuates beat tones and carriers. Cycle through Auto, Manual, and OFF.

blocks.name: Preamplifier
blocks.description: P.AMP1 is optimized for HF. P.AMP2 is optimized for 50/70 MHz. Select via Multi-function menu.

blocks.name: Twin Peak Filter (TPF)
blocks.description: RTTY-specific filter that boosts mark and space frequencies (2125 Hz mark, 170 Hz shift). Available only in RTTY mode.

blocks.name: RTTY Mark Frequency
blocks.description: Sets the RTTY mark frequency for the decoder. Found in RTTY decode settings.

blocks.text: The IC-7300MK2 requires 13.8V DC power. Connect using the supplied DC power cable with fuse holder. The transceiver is designed for base station use.
NEVER apply more than 16V DC or reverse polarity. NEVER apply AC power to the DC socket. The transceiver emits RF energy - follow RF exposure guidelines.
The MK2 version has slightly improved power consumption at receive standby (0.7A typical vs 0.9A on original IC-7300).
The IC-7300MK2 has a built-in automatic antenna tuner covering HF through 50 MHz (and 70 MHz on European versions). The tuner can match impedances up to 3:1 VSWR.
To enable the tuner, push [TUNER]. The TUNER indicator lights when active. Hold [TUNER] for 1 second to initiate manual tuning. Typical tuning time is 2-3 seconds, maximum 15 seconds.
The IC-7300MK2 has three antenna connectors: one SO-239 for TX/RX and two SMA connectors for RX only. This allows using separate receive antennas or antenna diversity.
The SMA antenna connectors are receive-only. Transmitting only uses the SO-239 connector.

rows.name: Operating Modes
rows.value: USB, LSB, CW, RTTY, AM, FM

rows.name: Dimensions
rows.value: 240 x 94 x 237.6 mm (W x H x D)

blocks.name: No power
blocks.description: Check DC power connection and fuses (5A, 25A, 30A supplied). Verify supply voltage is 13.8V +/-15%.

blocks.name: Spurious signals received
blocks.description: Spurious signals may appear near 2.066, 4.133, 9.140, and 27.426 MHz. These are from internal circuits and are normal.

blocks.name: Touch screen unresponsive
blocks.description: LCD protection film may interfere with touch operation. Remove any screen protectors. Use touch screen calibration if needed.

blocks.name: CW decode not working
blocks.description: Ensure you are in CW mode. Check that the signal is strong enough and properly tuned. The decoder requires clear CW signals.

blocks.name: HDMI display not working
blocks.description: Verify HDMI cable is securely connected. Check external display input selection. The HDMI output mirrors the main display.

blocks.name: Network connection issues
blocks.description: Check network settings in SET > Network. Verify Network Name and passwords are correct. Network User ID requires 16 characters max.

blocks.name: Weld lines visible on case
blocks.description: These streaks that may appear on the case surface are from the molding process and are not cracks or defects.

blocks.name: Split frequency offset
blocks.description: Use the Split Frequency Offset feature for convenient split operation. Access via FUNCTION or menu system.
